rationale: The agent's implementation has a critical correctness flaw: it builds settings twice by first calling `put(SettingsLoader.Helper.loadNestedFromMap(...))` then immediately calling `build().getAsMap()` on the result, which is inefficient and loses the direct Map<String,String> from loadNestedFromMap. Ground truth correctly iterates directly over loadNestedFromMap's output. The agent is incomplete: it only modified the existing template.json to remove 'index.' prefixes (changing the test data instead of the code handling both formats), while ground truth renamed template.json to template0.json, created template1.json (without index prefix) and template2.json (with nested index object), and modified IndexTemplateFileLoadingTests.java to randomly select between templates. The agent completely missed the test file changes and the new template variants that validate both formats work. Code reuse is worse because it unnecessarily builds settings objects twice. Best practices are slightly worse due to the redundant intermediate build step. No unsolicited documentation was added.
